reviews.sentence: Very pleasant stay. Hotel services very good. Only attention point is that after our check in the temperature in the room was rather high. Breakfast was good unfortunately no fresh juice available. Breakfast was very crowdy too many guests for the available seatsAl in all a very good stay.

Nice modern hotel in convenience location. Room was very clean and staff were pleasant. Easy walk to the tram and local shops. The downside is that it is not really located near the night life and main action. If that is what you are looking for you might want to stay a bit further north.

Good hotel with very pleasant staff. Very pleasant but would have liked a room higher we were in basement. Restaurant was lovely great to see the chefs at workWould have liked a bath the shower water made a lot of mess would have liked milk carton in room for my tea brought my own teabags as only lemon in room. Overall would definitely stay here again.

Just ok. Hotel was old. Rooms were small and very hot. No air conditioning. The only way to regulate the temperature at all was to open a window some. The temperature outside was in the 40s F yet even sleeping or trying to sleep on top of the cover was difficult at best. I was totally exhausted the entire stay due to lack of sleep. The room was clean except the carpet was stained. The staff was nice and the breakfast buffet served to our Trafalgar tour was good. There was free wifi but it was pretty much useless. It was enough to sync my Fitbit but I could get or send e mail or get on the Internet. Room was fairly dark and therefore gloomy.

Walking distance from RAI convention center and central museums. We got upgraded to a great suite with a glass wall overlooking the canals. Was fantasticGreat location for what we needed walking distance to RAI convention center and to the big museums. Downside is that the restaurants are not in the immediate neighborhood. However the staff were great about recommending an area with lots of very varied little restaurants on Scheldeplein ten minutes walk away so all was well.
Quiet location right on the canal. Staff very friendly and helpful. Terrace overlooking the canal was great during a warm sunny evening.

Pleasant stay. Stayed for 3 night as part of a Trafalgar tour. Arrived before 10 am and got a room right away. Nice surprise. The reception staff was very helpful but they were almost always busy. Room was nice and clean. Bath towels were crisp. Bathtub was deep. There was a full size mirror. Hotel is on a canal in a nice quite neighborhood. Walk to museum quarter took 20 minutes. Soap and shampoo made in Germany was nice. Appreciated the complementary bottled water made in Italy. Wifi in room was weak. Breakfast was plentiful. Enjoyed the little pancakes sausages bacon fruits passion fruits water melon juice yogurt. Hotel got a nice restaurant on the canal. There are quite a few restaurants and a Albert Heijn supermarket in the De Pijp area which is 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel also offers airport shuttle service. Overall I enjoyed my short stay very much. I would love to return on an independent trip to Amsterdam in the future.

Was nice being right on the canal would have been better with a view of the canal not the main drive way. The hotel lobby was very beautiful as was the lobby bar and restaurant. When you got to the rooms they were a bit tired and dated. We were with a tour group and would have been nice to let the hotel showcase the city and offer canal view rooms to us instead of all the flight crews staying at the hotel. Instead we all were offered views of the main driveway. Beds were very comfortable but air conditioning was on the light side considering it was warm when you were looking to cool off. Loved the hotel overlooking the canal to enjoying over the very nice morning breakfast offered at the hotel. Also a nice short walk to the metro it get to all the sights you needed.
Nice hotel. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Loud guests at 0630 having a conversation in the hallway outside room.
Great hotel for a business trip. Extremely helpful and friendly reception staff who sorted out my room request efficiently. Loved the location by the canal.

Super. I stayed here multiple times and it gives me a smile everytime I visited this hotel. Very friendly staff and lovely rooms. I remember that a colleague and I wanted to see a football match but there was no TV available at that moment. Therefore the staff openend one of the meeting rooms to watch the game. They even served drinks there. It was one of the best things I expercienced in a hotel. This hotel offers everything you need for a perfect stay on a business trip. When you stay at the hotel I would recommend to visit the Harbour Club Kitchen for dinner. Excellent food and wonderful atmosphere. In short one of the best hotels I visited.

Ver very worst service. No drinking water in room. Lot of problems in rooms also. we have informed. And still not yet offered water. Almost 8 hrs gone. We have blocked this hotel for 3 days. Oh my god. How do we stay another 2 days. This is group booking. Otherwise I will cancel will be stayed other hotel.

Simply amazing. Our flight was delayed by a day due to horrible weather and the staff were kind enough to amend the dates for us at no additional cost on a very short notice. Staff at the restaurant could be a bit friendlier and attentive.

Comfortable Hotel in great location. This was a very comfortable and convenient Hotel to the RAI and the trams. There are some excellent eateries nearby I recommend La Falote for dinner if you want a genuine Dutch dinner. The Hotel staff were really friendly and helpful and you felt that they would do anything for you. The room was very clean and serviced well. The beds firm and the airconditioning excellent. Only one lift was in service and thus we had to wait a long time to get to our 4th floor room in the mornings and afternoons when everyone was using it. But that is pretty nit picky. Generally the place was great.

Nicely appointed hotel and room. This is a large hotel located near tram lines and museums. The rooms are large and tidy ask for a canal view and enjoy the large balcony. The staff are resourceful and helpful. Note that both the lounge and restaurant were vastly understaffed while we were there. While service was poor the view was spectacular as 5 canals meet at this point and there is always something happening. I would suspect that the staffing problem was temporary as it is a very nice hotel.

Nice choice. Good hotel overlooking a canal. You can reach the city center with a 20 min walk. We had a problem the first morning with workers hammering at 7 am and we asked to change room which was done in 5 minutes thumbs up for the very efficient and professional staff. Breakfast is very good large choice of food and really nice restaurant overlooking the canal.

Worst wannabe boutique hotel in Amsterdam. Apollo Hotel as a building with its amenities is very good. The room specs and breakfast match with the rating. The hotel is managed badly. We had two days insufficient. no room service and asked 3 times for support in shutting down the air conditioning as it always went on automatically during the nights but did not get once support. First time I had difficulties with payment handling in a hotel. The personel is very arrogant in the licensed outlets especially at the bar. It is a good place for overseas one time guests from the states and Asia. Nothing for potential regular guests who are looking for consistent quality and honest service.
Very Good. Receptionist refused our request for flower vase.
Pleasant. It ’s low key relaxed quiet. Terrible pillows plastic flowers and furry throws. No minibar. Carpet stains. Staff had problems with check out. It took too long and they did not provide bill.
